title: Haunch of Venison sans serif
tags: Sans Serif Haunch of Venison Spin Design
content:
Does anybody have any idea of what the font is that Spin used on Haunch of Venison?

It's the main sans serif used on the overall brand, rather than the various different typefaces used for individual exhibitions etc.

[http://spin.co.uk/work-by-discipline/identity/haunch-of-venison](http://web.archive.org/web/20140715070619/http:/spin.co.uk/work-by-discipline/identity/haunch-of-venison "http://spin.co.uk/work-by-discipline/identity/haunch-of-venison")

Everything I've been looking at with those 'U's without the stem etc. etc. have straight arms (? is that the correct term?) on the uppercase 'R', but if you look closely on the vertical set type down the side of some of the posters, if you have a look at the words 'BERLIN' and 'ZURICH' it appears there is a slight curve on the 'R' there.

I'm stumped!

Any help would be appreciated.

Thanks!
author: geedee

comments.content: I'm probably wrong but to me, the main sans looks like [Helvetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20140715070619/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/helvetica)...

Ha! We were thinking that actually, there was something that threw us off though but I can't think what it was!

I think we've finally cracked it though – Haas Unica.

I can sleep tonight now.
Seeing Haas Unica, I now understand what you meant by "it appears there is a slight curve on the 'R' there". So yes, there's big chance it could be Haas Unica.
